title: Deaf people still want Closed Captions...

embed.description: Get more done faster by voice with Dragon, the world's best-selling speech recognition software. It turns your talk into text and can make virtually any computer task easier and faster, helping you become more productive than ever before.

body:
{{item:2050}} 

Hey RIOT Fam,

I think getting closed captions for the Deaf crew up and running on your eSports stuff would be very very cool.
Currently I've been transcribing the World's finals games, and it's literally taking forever.
You could use a program like Dragon NaturallySpeaking.

Interpreters isn't an option, as sign language is just like hearing language, and is different around the world, so I understand why you don't have any...
but using a program to transcribe, would be very easy, a 2man team could do it, and then translate it to all of the different languages around the world, but using things like Translation programs.

Dragon NaturallySpeaking is very easy to setup. Each person that talks has to say a couple of sentences, and then that literally locks their voice to automatically transcribe.
Now, sure, it's not perfect, but it's the best option for right now... as hiring someone to short hand transcribe would be very costly.
Of course, there are many programs to do this, I just know how great Dragon is, and how easy it is to setup.
Have a think about it.
Bring it up in your meetings and stuff.
This is pretty vital to people with hearing issues, who love playing this game, and love watching the Pros, whilst being included with the exciting shout casting, interviews and all the other cool stuff that happens at these events.

Thanks for reading.

{{summoner:31}} {{summoner:31}} {{summoner:31}} {{summoner:31}} {{summoner:31}}

replies.body:
@BaconPoroDeluxe - hey man just want to let you know that we have read your thread and Its a really cool idea. I couldn't provide an estimate of when we would be able to release something like this, but it is definitely something on the list :)

Thanks for giving us some ideas for an option of how to do it to :) I definitely second Talwyn's thoughts. Top stuff, keep it up :)

Thanks Belquin. The Deaf crew bring it up all the time... and how it makes them not really wanna watch it.... that and Rek's ult when on enemy team. (no visual cue).... *winky eye* ;)

I am excited to let them know progress is going to happen. Thank You.
From all of us around the world. 

x
No worries at all, the hardest part is 'when', which I do not have an indication on at all, it could still be a while away but we will get there!

Hey,
That's an amazing thing you are doing. I can't imagine how long it must take to transcribe all of those games by hand. I definitely think Riot should implement some sort of thing for people who are deaf. With my finals finished I have plenty of spare time on my hand. If you ever need help with anything whilst working on this project I would be happy to lend my assistance. Regardless, what an amazing effort and an amazing idea! 
Have a great day!
